did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, Manuscripts, Photographs, Legal Documents, Printed Materials
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, clippings, newsletters, photographs, minutes of meetings, programs, incorporation papers pertaining to a Cornell University cooperative living unit, with particular reference to social issues and visits from Eleanor Roosevelt, Marion Anderson and Norman Thomas.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Co-op founded as a non-discriminatory fraternity.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, clippings, newsletters, photographs, minutes of meetings, programs, incorporation papers pertaining to a Cornell University cooperative living unit, with particular reference to social issues and visits from Eleanor Roosevelt, Marian Anderson and Norman Thomas.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions:
userestrict.p: Due to the fragility and potential degradation of moving image and sound recordings, viewing and listening is limited to items that have been digitized. If an item is in another media format, you may request to have the item digitized for access. Information on ordering access copies may be found on the Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections webpage.
Audio visual media that has been digitized: V-11293 .

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Watermargin records, #37-4-446. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Group Photos - 2004 and 2006; CD of photos from Iron Chef Competition

scopecontent.p: "Sixty years after Watermargin's founding, Wei (Cornell '02) tracked down the surviving founders and several first generation alumni in order to document their stories and accomplishments of the beloved house located on Ithaca's 103 McGraw Place."

did.unittitle: Origins - Constitution, meaning of the name
Conference - "Inter-Group Living and the College Campus"
Applications for those attending the Watermargin Conference and Correspondence
Langston Hughes - Programs, signed book The Dream Keeper
Field Trips - Arkansas and NYC and bound copy of "Watermargin Arkansas Study Trip"
Committees - Nominating, Dedication, Communications, Secretarial, etc.
"In the Margin"; books of quotes and programs; "Watermelon, Inc"
Photographs - group picture of the Founders and others
Proposal that a National Association for Intercultural Living be formed
Cooperatives elsewhere - N. American Student Cooperative League (NASCL)
Watermargin - Board of Directors Meeting Minutes
Slides - M. Anderson Concert, Farm and Work Party, others
Cassette tapes: 45th Reunion Conference - ACTWV Hall-NYC (Dec. 1993) - Death Penalty in the 1990's - John Blume - Tom Levanduski - His experience in the Persian Gulf (April 1992)
16mm Film: Norman Thomas, Eleanor Roosevelt, One unidentified
Reel to Reel Film - Education Committee - Speaker Series
Watermargin - flyers, clippings, programs of events
NASCO (North American Students of Cooperation) newsbriefs, pamphlets
Miscellaneous correspondence and memoranda; Handmade poster
Phonograph Record: Bad Company Rough Diamonds
